cluster_relations.rel_desc: Black holes challenge our understanding of the cosmos or universe.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The subject poses a conceptual or epistemic challenge to the object, straining or questioning the adequacy of the object as an explanation or framework.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Black holes challenge or strain our existing knowledge.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The subject poses a conceptual or epistemic challenge to the object, straining or questioning the adequacy of the object as an explanation or framework.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Human Scientific Knowledge About Black Holes

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: in studying black holes and their implications

args.justification: Both relations describe an epistemic or conceptual tension (black holes vs. our understanding/knowledge), not a direct causal mechanism in the physical sense. Mapping the broad group to INTERACTION better captures that these are conceptual interactions between phenomena and human understanding, while the existing rel_cls 'conceptual_tension_relation' remains appropriate.
args.remark: Rel_cls_group changed from CAUSALITY to INTERACTION to better reflect epistemic/conceptual interaction rather than physical cause-effect.

executed_decisions.justification: Both relations describe an epistemic or conceptual tension (black holes vs. our understanding/knowledge), not a direct causal mechanism in the physical sense. Mapping the broad group to INTERACTION better captures that these are conceptual interactions between phenomena and human understanding, while the existing rel_cls 'conceptual_tension_relation' remains appropriate.
executed_decisions.remark: Rel_cls_group changed from CAUSALITY to INTERACTION to better reflect epistemic/conceptual interaction rather than physical cause-effect.
